definition:
The digestive path of
an &%Animal, consisting of the &%Mouth, &%Esophagus, &%Stomach, &%Intestines and &%Rectum.
opposite_reasoning: GastroIntestinalTract lacks a true antonym as it's a specific anatomical structure. Among organ systems, NervousSystem provides the strongest functional contrast: material processing/transformation vs information processing/signaling. Both are essential animal systems but operate on fundamentally different substrates (matter vs signals). This provides reasonable semantic distance for Fisher-LDA while maintaining ontological coherence. However, this is fundamentally a weak opposition case - the concept is too specific and domain-constrained for strong opposite pairing relevant to AI safety concerns.
